about.desc:
[Bot description]

> *Use `{prefix}help` to get the information about most commands.*
about.indev: The bot is operating in DEBUG mode that means some bugs may appear. We recommend you to refrain from using it until the maintainance is complete.
about.creator: <> with ‚ù§ by {creator}

help.title: Available commands
help.desc:
*`[argument=X]` - an optional argument. If it wasn't stated by you - it'll default to X.*
*`<argument>` means that it is required.*

about.desc: Prints the info about the bot.

ping.desc: Returns the latency time. You may want to use that to check the bot working.

settings.desc: Prints the current server configuration. Only admins are allowed to use this command and every subcommand.

prefix.desc: Changes the bot prefix for this server. Empty argument resets the setting to `!`.

language.desc: Changes the bot language for this server.

leave.desc: Properly remove the bot from your server with or without wiping the config. Only admins are allowed to use this command.

shutdown.msg: *Stopping the bot and shutting down the host...*
shutdown.error_indev: *The bot is operating in DEBUG mode. Host shutdown is unavailable.*

technical.indev_notif: > **WARNING! The bot is operating in DEBUG mode. Please refrain from using this mode if there are no tests running.**

lang.title: Bot language changed successfully
lang.desc: The bot will speak English from now on.

leave.desc_msg:
Are you sure you want the bot to leave? Choose an option below.

Leave - the bot will leave and remove only its webhooks and deassign log channel.
Leave and forget - will also remove every trail of the server from the bot databases.
Cancel - keep the bot.

leave.label: Leave
leave.title: {name} left the server. Goodbye!
leave.desc: We hope you enjoyed using our bot! Just in case you change your mind, we kept your configuration, so we can continue working just like before when you decide to let us come back.

purge.label: Leave and forget
purge.title: {name} left and wiped data
purge.desc: We hope you enjoyed using our bot! All data about your server was wiped from our servers, so you can stay calm and not worry about your privacy. In case if you change your mind about us leaving, you still can get the bot working again, although it may be required to reconfigure it.

cancel.label: Cancel
cancel.title: Leaving cancelled
cancel.desc: The bot is staying on the server. We won't disappoint you.

global_errors.max_concurrency: *The maximum amount of command instances is being processed right now.*
global_errors.channel_not_found: *It seems there is no such channel in this server.*
global_errors.bot_insufficient_perms: *The bot doesn't have enough permissions to complete this action.*
global_errors.guild_admins_only: *You don't have enough permissions to use this command.*
global_errors.missing_required_argument: *You have missed a required argument. Check the command usage syntax.*
global_errors.forbidden: *Something won't let me do this, sorry.*
global_errors.not_owner: *Only bot owner is allowed to do that.*
global_errors.no_history_access: *The bot cannot access the message history and therefore unable to complete this action.*

privacy.title: Anastellos Engine Example Privacy Policy
privacy.desc:
> __THIS IS A PLACEHOLDER VERSION OF PRIVACY POLICY, MAKE YOUR CHANGES BEFORE USING IT__

This document ("Privacy Policy") only applies to the instance of Bot Name hosted by the bot account <@80351110224678912> ("Bot"). The use of the Bot in a server (guild) requires the processing and/or storing of some specific user data ("Data").
*To use the Bot, you are required to agree to the terms of Privacy Policy. If you decline them, the Bot will leave the server automatically.*

**Processing of Data:**
Bot starts processing the guild ID as soon as it is invited to a server. It can be shown in the developer console, which is cleared every time the Bot is being turned off.
The Bot might log IDs of the users who typed any valid commands into any channel, accessible by the Bot, sent a direct message to the Bot, or explicitly mentioned the Bot in any channel.
The Bot processes and/or caches almost all the accessible Data including but not limited to: message IDs, message content, message attachments, member IDs, member usernames, member server nicknames, member avatar URLs, member custom statuses with the purpose of operating properly, although it cannot be accessed by the developer directly.

**Storing of Data:**
The Bot does not store any user Data until the person managing the mentioned account grants permission to do so for reasons including but not limited to: attribution for help in developing/translating the Bot.
After a member with the permission to Manage Server accepts the terms of Privacy Policy, the Bot writes the guild ID into the local database to store the server configuration. It also stores preferences including but not limited to: prefix, language code.

**Access to Data:**
The mentioned Data is stored on a personal computer of the Bot developer. Only they are able to access and/or modify the Data at any given time.

**Removal of Data:**
The Bot is able to delete the server preferences alongside with its ID from the database by using the option "Leave and forget", provided by using the command `ae!leave`.
In case if you want to remove all your user information (considering you gave your permission to store it before), you can request the removal manually by contacting the Bot developer in the direct messages or in the support server.

> The developer reserves the right to modify this document at any given time, with or without noticing the users.

*This document is available in following languages: `en`, `qps-ploc`.*
